thread.title: Rogic’s huge boost, Ryan opens up on move
thread.title_full: Rogic’s huge boost, Ryan opens up on move

title: Rogic’s huge boost, Ryan opens up on move
text:
Aussie Media Watch: Tom Rogic injury news, Ryan and Luongo latest, Wanderers bid rejected February 3, 2017 11:40am by Staff writers with AAP Source: FOX SPORTS SOCCEROO Tom Rogic has received a huge injury boost while Mat Ryan opens up about his move back to Belgium. 
Plus another Wanderers striker link rejected by FFA … again. 
It’s an Aussie Media Watch! 
TOM ROGIC SET FOR RETURN 
Tom Rogic is set to make his long awaited return from injury after coming back to training with Celtic. 
A long layoff with an ankle injury meant Rogic spent six weeks on the sideline, and during that time his club side beat Hearts to chalk up a record 26 successive undefeated domestic games. 
But coach Brendan Rodgers has said the Socceroo comes back into contention for selection as Celtic prepare to face St Johnstone on Sunday night (AEDT). 
Rodgers said: “Tom Rogic is back training now. We will see how he is for the weekend.” Tom Rogic is close to returning for Celtic. Source: Getty Images 
RYAN OPENS UP ON TRANSFER 
Mat Ryan has revealed Valencia rejected chances of moving to rival Spanish clubs after playing his first game for new club Racing Genk in Belgium. 
The Socceroos shotstopper played his first game in a 1-0 loss to Oostende in the Belgian Cup semi-final just a couple of days after joining on loan in January and explained his thinking behind choosing to return to Belgium. 
“Game time is what every footballer wants in their career and unfortunately I wasn’t getting enough of it at Valencia,” he told Genk’s official site. 
“Being a big couple of years coming up for my career, both personally and with the national team, it was necessary to go out in search of more game time. 
“Thankfully the opportunity arose at Genk.” Ryan moving to Belgium 0:23 
Ryan added: “I have regular contact with the national team coach and he is always publicly saying how it’s very important that his players are playing regularly for their club teams. 
“Anderlecht had some interest in the beginning and there was interest from a few teams in Spain. I would’ve liked to have stayed in Spain but unfortunately Valenica saw those clubs as rivals and were reluctant to let me go there. 
“When it came to my playing future I spoke to him (Postecoglou) about a few of my options and also spoke to my agent and of course my family. 
“However, in the end Genk was the best fit for me and I really want to do my best and help the club achieve success.” 
WANDERERS STRIKER SIGNING REJECTED 
Macedonian and Italian press has reported that another Western Sydney Wanderers striker target was knocked back by FFA after agreeing to terms. 
Tutto Mercato reported former Inter Milan, Lazio and Napoli attacker Goran Pandev had accepted a two-year deal with Tony Popovic’s side. Macedonian website gol.mk also led with the story, saying salary cap rules was the reason for FFA rejecting the deal. 
It follows reports that FFA had denied Wanderers a chance to sign former Arsenal striker Eduardo as a guest marquee. 
However a club source told Fox Sports they heard no discussion of Pandev during recruitment talks. 
Pandev, 33, is currently contracted to Serie A side Genoa. Tony Popovic, Coach of the Wanderers. Source: News Corp Australia 
SAINSBURY UNVEILED BY INTER 
Trent Sainsbury has been unveiled by Inter Milan for the first time since joining the club on loan. 
Sainbury’s move sent shockwaves across Australian football, coming out of the blue on deadline day. 
Yet the Socceroos centre back has spoken of his excitement at joining the Italian giants for the rest of the season. 
“I must admit to go to a club of this stature is a bit of a shock,” the 25 year-old told the Daily Telegraph . 
“I was thinking maybe I would go back to Holland and prove myself in European football again but this massive opportunity has come my way, one that I certainly couldn’t turn down.” 
Sainsbury reiterated his excitement in this short interview with Inter TV. 
LUONGO’S NEW DEAL 
Meanwhile, fellow Socceroos star Massimo Luongo is reportedly on the verge of signing a new contract with English Championship side Queens Park Rangers. 
After an indifferent first season with the London side, Luongo has cemented his spot at the heart of Rangers midfield after adding more defensive structure to his game. 
According to West London Sport website, the 24-year-old has agreed terms on a two-and-a-half year extension to the final 12 months of his existing deal and will put pen to paper next week. 
Rangers have made it a priority to lock up the services of Luongo to prevent him from walking away on a Bosman free transfer next season after he impressed new manager Ian Holloway. 
The Sydneysider, who was voted player of the tournament at the Asia Cup in 2015, is well settled in London with his English wife and young daughter. 
He spoke recently about ignoring the temptation of accepting a big-money move to China to fulfil his desire to play in the Premier League. Super-sub Mooy seals Cup win 0:37 
YOUNG AUSSIE RELISHING GETTING ‘SMASHED’ 
Young Aussie Aiden O’Neill is relishing the chance to get smashed into shape after he sealed a deadline day loan move to League One side Oldham. 
Having left Premier League side Burnley as the transfer window came to a close, the 18-year-old midfielder spoke to the World Game about how the experience will prepare him for life as a professional first team footballer. 
“I am sure people will be out to smash me and it’s going to be a good challenge to show that I can be smashed but just keep getting back up,” he said. 
“It’s going to be tough but I’m relishing that. 
“Obviously I will have to fight for my place like anybody else but I hope to go in there a help them get out of the position they’re in at the moment. 
“Chesterfield away first up should be a good experience... they are a point ahead of us and we need a result.” View All Comments The latest sports news, in your inbox daily. Email
